sprite.name: Nothing
sprite.notes: Not all the 'nothing' sprites use the same Class ID The 'nothing' sprites might try to do something. But it would need some sort of hacking knowledge to find out what.

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: Nothing appears when this sprite is spawned.

Needs to be placed on top of a pipe to work.

field.notes: Unused (used in NSMBW).

field.name: No. of fireballs

Sound Set: 00, 01, 05, 06, 07, 09, 0A, 0C, 0D, 0E, 18, 19, 1A, 1B, 1C, 1D, 1E, 1F, 20

sprite.name: Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: Uses sound set 8.

field.name: Spawn type
field.notes: 2=Explodes in 5 NSMB-seconds

field.name: Stays idle
field.notes: Peach will ignore cinematics.

sprite.name: Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: Benjamin: I do remember other values existing, but I haven't tested them in a while, so I don't remember.

field.name: Type
field.notes: 'Swims' on walls: makes fish follow the ground and swim up walls and on ceilings.

sprite.name: Goal Pole Flag
sprite.notes: AKA Flagpole Flag

sprite.name: Springboard
sprite.notes: An item used to make Mario jump higher.

field.name: Giant
field.notes: Mario jumps higher on it. Unused - Used in Unused Level 2

sprite.name: Red coin ring
sprite.notes: 3E 00 00 03 00 00 - Create a trail of blue coins for a short period of time? Loads both the red ring files and the blue ring files.

field.name: Output ID
field.notes: Will activate IDs like any other switch

sprite.name: Giant Bowser/pot/Bowser Jr.
sprite.notes: and bowser jr?

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: Falls down if Mario/Luigi is in the range. The small Thwomps cannot destroy any tiles.

sprite.name: Boo
sprite.notes: Trying to replace a .bin (contains frames of 2D enemies) with 3D models will result in graphical glitches.

field.name: Win Cutscene
field.notes: Shows Bowser Jr and Peach. Used by the game when boss is defeated

sprite.name: Lakitu (unused)
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns Lakitu once. Once it's killed, it will not respawn. If you want it to respawn, use sprite Lakitu Spawner (183) instead. If your Sprite Set doesn't have Bullet Bill/Bomb in it, the game will freeze.

field.name: Spawn from BG
field.notes: If set, makes Lakitu come from the BG like in sprite 183.

field.name: Output ID
field.notes: Triggers Bowser, Dry Bowser and Giant Bowser falling animation.

field.name: Destroys tiles at
field.values: 0=2 tiles below switch,1=1 tile below switch

sprite.name: Chain Chomp / Log
sprite.notes:
incomplete cause of unexplained crash
When the crash setting is enabled It probably trys to load a file that does not exist - try loading the debug mode after it crashes or try using this: http://nsmbhd.net/?page=thread&id=396

field.name: Type
field.notes: Just log is unused. Unknown glitches the game and is used in unused level 3

sprite.name: Chomp / No-Log Chain Chomp
sprite.notes: Possibly spawned by 42 (chain chomp with log)?

sprite.name: Invisible Coin Block
sprite.notes: Can be used on top of tiles. And is used like that, for if flagpole staircases are destroyed.

sprite.name: Spiked ball activator
sprite.notes: Activates a Spiked Ball when the green blocks pass over it.

sprite.name: Pipe Bubbles (up)
sprite.notes: Setting both input IDs to zero will make the bubbles always run.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

sprite.name: Pipe Bubbles (down)
sprite.notes: Setting both input IDs to zero will make the bubbles always run.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

sprite.notes: Setting both input IDs to zero will make the bubbles always run.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

sprite.name: Pipe Bubbles (left)
sprite.notes: Setting both input IDs to zero will make the bubbles always run.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: You can start or stop bubbles using this ID.

field.name: Type
field.values: 0=Normal,1=Roof type/Start rolling,2=Start as shell,3=Start upside-down shell

sprite.name: Podoboo
sprite.notes: Goes back and forth from sprite position and lava.

field.name: Y position
field.values: 0=Doesn't spawn,1=Fires at Mario,2=Fire from sprite placement

field.name: Zone ID
field.notes: Spawns from the right edge of screen when player is in zone.

field.name: Uses zones
field.notes: If unchecked, the sprite spawns doesn't care if player is in the zone, and fires anyway/

field.name: Type
field.values: 0=Regular,1=In bubble,2=Three in bubble,3=Hops up-left,4=Drops,5=Hops,6=Moves right,7=Moves up-left,8=From block,11=Hops high up-left

field.name: Direction/behind Fence
field.values: 0=Left/in front,1=Left down/behind,2=Left/more down,7=Left down slow,10=Right,14=Up right Fast

sprite.name: Bowser (W1 castle)
sprite.notes: After roaring it allows Mario to move after boss activator makes him stop.

field.name: Switch Input ID
field.notes: Bowser Switch Output ID triggers this.

field.name: Input ID
field.notes: Falls and starts moving when activating (does not need boss activator)

sprite.name: Hammer Bro.
sprite.notes: Throws 2D hammers and jumps.

sprite.name: Bowser (W8 final castle)
sprite.notes:
Spawned out of pot in final boss.
Game crashes after roaring animation if used anywhere other than World 8 Final Castle Area 3.
The fireballs seem to crash the level. It is possible that a sprite set needs to be selected in order to use this sprite.

field.name: Switch Input ID
field.notes: Bowser Switch Output ID triggers this.

field.name: Switch Input ID
field.notes: Bowser Switch Output ID triggers this.

field.name: Stay in place
field.notes: Can move around and chase Mario when not checked

sprite.name: P-Switch
sprite.notes: This sprite shares its image file with ? switch, ! switch and Bowser Battle Switch.

field.name: Ouput mode
field.notes: Activation has to be started/enabled. Can toggle once started or ended by hitting the opposite sw. again.

field.name: Input ID
field.notes: 0=Ignore input ID, other value will wait for ID

field.name: Input mode
field.notes: Timer mode automatically resets switch to opposite output mode. Or it can be reset by another switch. With no timer, a start/stop toggle will respawn when you leave then return to the screen.

field.name: Timer mode
field.notes: When timed, switch starts in start or stop. While timed, it is opposite.

field.name: Time out sw. delay
field.notes: In seconds, Only delays multiple on/off hits

sprite.name: Sushi
sprite.notes: This sprite makes a shark enemy that goes left and right. Useful if you want to make a Sushi enemy without generators. This sprite might get spawned in-game by its generator (or it's a class ID).

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Used by the sprite 247. Value 2 makes Sushi swims on the side.

field.name: Behavior
field.values: 0=Back and forth,1=Appears depending of Mario facing direction,2=Appears left

field.name: Width
field.notes: Width formula is 1+(n mod 8) with n being the value of this nybble

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height formula is 2^(n mod 4) with n being the value of this nybble

field.name: Width
field.notes: Width formula is 1+(n mod 8) with n being the value of this nybble

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height formula is 2^(n mod 4) with n being the value of this nybble

sprite.name: Hanging metal platform
sprite.files: /enemy/W_rift.nsbmd possibly: W_kusari.nsbmd (chain) (might be for something else)

field.name: Distance
field.notes: 0 = Unlimited, 1 = 14 blocks, 2 to 15 = 16xValue blocks.

field.name: Longer
field.notes: Makes the platforms longer. Unused.

field.name: Offscreen pos.
field.notes: Used in the MvsL level. This controls what the platform does while off screen, best I can tell. Position is affected, but speed stays the same.

field.name: Stick to line
field.notes: If you want to go right put Clockwise. If you want to go left put Counterclockwise.

sprite.name: Self-activating brick/block
sprite.notes:
Brick/? block that activates when spawned. Used by the game when ? block is hit. Work in progress.
Fields in here were translated from single nibble flipping.
Please contribute by figuring out what the different combinations of sprite data do. Post your findings here: http://board.dirbaio.net/thread.php?id=244
Nibbles 6-7 with AA makes a dud block spawn something weird.
00 00 00 00 00 00

field.name: Unknown 4
field.values: 0=No modification,1=Throw item right,2=Dud block,9=Throw item left

field.name: Unknown 9
field.values: 0=No modification,1=Throw item right,4=Item falls/throw item if on solid,15=Item spawns like touchscreen

field.name: Unknown 10
field.values: 0=No modification,1=Dud block,2=Brick spawn item,3=Brick into dud block,4=Block disappear item goes up,5=Block disappear,6=? Block disappear item go down,7=Block disappear 2,8=Nibble value in sprite 31,9=Dud block 2,11=Dud block 3,12=10 coin brick + item,13=10 coin brick,14=static Coin + item going down,15=Static Coin

field.name: Item type
field.values: 0=Mushroom/Fire Flower,1=Starman,2=Coin,3=Poof?,4=2 Coins?,5=Mega Mushroom,6=Mushroom,7=1-Up,8=Mushroom 2,9=Fire Flower,10=Vine,11=Blue Shell,12=Mushroom 3,13=Spring,14=Mushroom 4,15=No Item?
field.notes: Having Raw Sprite Data 00 00 00 00 0F 59 is mini mushroom for some reason.

sprite.name: Zoom
sprite.notes: Technically the documentation for this sprite is complete, just confusing, there is a suggestion of a visual representation of the sprites effects to make it easier to understand: http://nsmbhd.net/thread/1566-visual-representation-of-sprites-84-and-245-suggestion/#23062

field.name: Zoom left
field.notes: This value will match the width (in tiles) in-game. By default the game uses a width of 16 tiles, with this sprite you can use any width between 8 and 24 included. Don't forget the game always use a ratio of 4 tiles in width for 3 tiles in height, so to keep the best aspect you might want to put in this field a value divisible by 4.

field.name: Zoom right
field.notes: Same comment as above.

sprite.name: Triangle spinner
sprite.notes: "Only someone with direct access to the database can procede this modification : Class ID is actually 180, not 6 !"

field.name: Stick to line
field.notes: If you want to go right put clockwise. If you want to go left put counterclockwise.

field.name: Output mode
field.notes: Activation has to be started/enabled. Can toggle once started or ended by hitting the opposite sw. again

field.name: Input mode
field.notes: Timer mode automatically resets switch to opposite output mode. Or it can be reset by another switch. With no timer, a start/stop toggle will respawn when you leave then return to the screen.

field.name: Timer mode
field.notes: When timed, switch starts in start or stop. While timed, it is opposite.

field.name: Time out sw. delay
field.notes: In seconds, Only delays multiple on/off hits

field.name: Upside down
field.notes: When hit, an upside down P-switch will appear in the place where the brick block was.

sprite.name: Line platform
sprite.notes: You can't make it longer, so try putting two beside each other without "Wait for Mario" checked.

field.name: Wait for Mario
field.notes: Will only move when stood on.

field.name: Falling speed
field.notes: Used in unused level 1 only

sprite.name: Unagi
sprite.notes: This sprite will not spawn if none of the values are checked.

field.name: Moves Left
field.notes: Overrides move right setting

field.name: Non-moving
field.notes: Overrides other settings

field.name: Size
field.notes: Somewhat buggy when putting values between 2 and 17 inclusive as the sprite and the hitbox become completely disjointed.

field.name: Unknown 8
field.notes: Used in-game, useless.

field.name: Unknown 9
field.notes: Used in-game, useless.

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: Unused in-game Unknown - Looks like it's nothing...

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: Unused in-game Unknown - Seems to be nothing

sprite.name: Event Controller - "View Enter"
sprite.notes: Activates an event when the view is loaded - used in NSMBW.

field.name: Event ID
field.notes: This event will be activated when the view loads.

field.name: Time Activated
field.notes: This value only works if Switch Mode is set to Activate Event, and sets a duration that the event ID will be activated for.

field.name: Does Nothing
field.notes: Makes the sprite skip it's function and delete itself.

field.name: Reverse-Input ID 1
field.notes: This one will have no effect if Reverse-Input ID 2 is equal to 0.

field.name: Reverse-Input ID 2
field.notes: The spiked ball won't spawn while the ID is activated. 0=disable

field.name: Spiked Ball ID
field.notes: For use with Spiked Ball Activator (46)

field.name: Spawning method
field.notes: For one side only : if starting direction is left, the spiked ball will spawn only if Mario is at the left of said sprite; and of course if starting direction is right, the spiked ball will spawn only if Mario is at the right of said sprite.

sprite.name: Dorrie
sprite.notes:
If end path node is not set, Dorrie will keep going back and forth between last two nodes. Set end as value 1 in unknown 6.
Using value 256 in unknown 3 will lower Dorrie's head. 512 will raise it again. Set this at each node you want a change or it will continue from last node setting.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: Starts facing away from background and turns to actual direction when activated. If set to zero, Dorrie won't start until touched by Mario. Unused.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: Starts facing away from background and turns to actual direction when activated. If set to zero, Dorrie won't start until touched by Mario. Unused.

field.name: Direction
field.notes: 2 and 3 don't function properly. 1, 2 and 3 are Unused.

field.name: Size
field.notes: Size is 1 + (nybble6 mod 4).

field.name: Start Node
field.notes: 255=Appear Always, 0=Appear at level start, Anything else=Appear from midway

sprite.name: Tornado / Twister
sprite.notes: Slings you up in the air.

sprite.name: Red coin
sprite.notes:
These will activate from input or output ID. They can be activated without the red coin red via there ID.
The group ID allows the coins to be counted to 8 in their own group. Using different group IDs will start count at 0 until all 8 of that group are collected.

sprite.name: ? Switch
sprite.notes:
Event ID's above 64 do not work
Test unused, strange function Output IDs (like make blue coins trail appear, see orange fox's post on jul)
62 makes blue coins appear

field.name: Input ID
field.notes: 0=Ignore input ID, other value will wait for ID

field.name: Input mode
field.notes: Timer mode automatically resets switch to opposite output mode. Or it can be reset by another switch. With no timer, a start/stop toggle will respawn when you leave then return to the screen.

field.name: Timer mode
field.notes: Setting this to 4 might make it only load when mario returns to a midway point after dying. Setting this to 8 might make the timer music not interrupt the level music (like red coin rings do by default).

field.name: Time out sw. delay
field.notes: In seconds. Only delays multiple on/off hits

field.name: Settings
field.notes: Cannot do separate tickboxes so put it in a list (cannot do more than one anyway).

sprite.notes: This sprite shares its image file with P-switch, ? switch and Bowser battle switch.

field.notes: Activation has to be started/enabled. Can toggle once started or ended by hitting the opposite sw. again.

field.notes: Timer mode automatically resets switch to opposite output mode. Or it can be reset by another switch. With no timer, a start/stop toggle will respawn when you leave then return to the screen.

field.name: Timer mode
field.notes: When timed, switch starts in start or stop. While timed, it is opposite.

field.name: Time out sw. delay
field.notes: In seconds, only delays multiple on/off hits

field.name: Shift
field.values: 0=None,1=½ block right,2=½ block down,3=½ block right and down

sprite.name: Brick block with red ! switch
sprite.notes: If I tested correctly the red ! switch should activate the unused red dotted coins...I am still not sure about this.

sprite.name: Fire Cannon (Small)
sprite.notes: A.K.A. thruster, flamethrower, burner...

field.name: Reverse-Input ID 1
field.notes: This one will have no effect if Reverse-Input ID 2 is equal to 0.

field.name: Reverse-Input ID 2
field.notes: The spiked ball won't spawn while the ID is activated. 0=disable

field.name: Spawning method
field.notes: For one side only : if starting direction is left, the spiked ball will spawn only if Mario is at the left of said sprite; and of course if starting direction is right, the spiked ball will spawn only if Mario is at the right of said sprite.

sprite.name: Red Winged ? Block
sprite.files:
/enemy/pata_block.nsbmd
This NSBMD contains red and gold flying blocks + wings sprites: 117 and 290

field.name: 16 tile loop
field.values: 0=Fly off screen,1=Center of Loop,2=Edge of Loop

field.name: Can spawn Mega Mushroom
field.notes: Gives a chance of getting a Mega Mushroom. The chances of gettting a Mini Mushroom seems to be reduced.

sprite.name: Fire Cannon
sprite.notes: (A.K.A. thruster, flamethrower, burner)

field.name: Size
field.notes: Big sizes should not be used, as they don't display unless the pivot is on-screen.

field.name: Swing angle
field.notes: 0=Does not move.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: 0=Does not move.

field.name: Starting position
field.values: 0=Bottom/Goes right,1=Bottom-Bottom-Right/Goes right,2=Bottom-Right/Goes right,3=Bottom-Right-Right/Goes right,4=Right/Goes left,5=Bottom-Right-Right/Goes left,6=Bottom-Right/Goes left,7=Bottom-Bottom-Right/Goes left,8=Bottom/Goes left,9=Bottom-Bottom-Left/Goes left,10=Bottom-Left/Goes left,11=Bottom-Left-Left/Goes left,12=Left/Goes right,13=Bottom-Left-Left/Goes right,14=Bottom-Left/Goes right,15=Bottom-Bottom-Left/Goes right
field.notes: Values when speed is 0. Change as the speed increases.

sprite.name: Super Venus Fire Trap (Big)
sprite.notes:
Unused. Used in NSMBWii. Can't be defeated by shells unlike all other Piranha Plants. (?) So maybe slightly incomplete.
Sound Set: 00, 01, 05, 06, 07, 09, 0A, 0C, 0D, 0E, 18, 19, 1A, 1B, 1C, 1D, 1E, 1F, 20

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: Unused in-game Unknown - Seems to be nothing

field.name: Closed time
field.notes: Standard: 1

field.name: Open time
field.notes: Standard: 1

field.name: Maximum angle ×11.25
field.notes: Note : 0 acts like 6.

sprite.name: Giant four platform spinner (stays in place)

field.name: Destination world
field.notes: Does also work with W1 to W4.

sprite.name: Boss battle key location
sprite.notes: If the boss is defeated, the Boss Battle Key falls on the place where you placed this sprite. If else it falls in a default place?

sprite.name: Jumping Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: Funny Glitch: If you put a green cheep cheep on the same screen as one of these, it becomes green!

field.name: Stays on screen
field.notes: Used in Cheepskipper battle

sprite.name: Midway point
sprite.notes: The midway point. The ID of the Start position needs to be configured in the View's settings.

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height formula is 2+(n mod 8) with n being the value of this nybble

sprite.name: Boss Key
sprite.notes: Spawned by boss sprites. Should be used as a standalone ONLY for testing purposes.

field.name: Unknown 11
field.notes: Blocks horizontal scrolling.

field.name: Length
field.notes: If both length and height are set, it will be diagonal.

sprite.name: Rotating spiked ? block (unused duplicate)
sprite.notes: Different class ID.

sprite.name: Rotating spiked ? block (unused duplicate)
sprite.notes: Different class ID.

sprite.name: Ground-Pound Panel
sprite.notes: Needs a ground-pound to be able to pass from top. Is jump-through from bottom.

field.name: Spawn Type
field.notes: Makes the Goomba spawn differently. All used. Work out what for yourself.

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: If you want to change colors in the Koopa Troopa's pallette, chosse 'I_enemy_B_ncl.bin', because that's the only one it works. I've tested that. When you change the colors with for example 'I_enemy_W_ncl', nothing'll change in NSMB DS.

field.name: In Shell
field.notes: Unused. (If you select blue, it won't be a blue shell-item)

sprite.name: Event on/off switch block
sprite.notes: Can't be activated by having a shell thrown at it.

sprite.name: Warp entrance
sprite.notes: The sprite will delete itself after a Warp and it will only re-spawn if you go to another area and back.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: Use this ID fo the warp to activate with the ID, and then deactivate after being used.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: Use this ID to activate ID and wait for an "off" command to turn off.

field.name: BROKEN option
field.notes: Disables sound if warping to other area.

field.name: Dest. area
field.notes: Set to 0 when warping to the same area.

field.name: Warp mode
field.values: 0=Set to this or to 8 if dest. is in another area,1=If climbing vine,3=Set to this or to 1 if Dest. is in current area,8=Wavy transition

sprite.name: Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: A basic mushroom platform, where Mario/Luigi can stand. There is unused stuff like moving when stood on. 7 is the maximum height that works with sprite data. If you want it to be longer, set it to 7 and then use a mushroom stalk object in the tileset to make the mushroom's stalk height look higher.

sprite.name: Input controller - "And" (If X AND Y, do Z)

field.name: Usage Mode
field.values: 0=Start ID activation,1=Stop ID activation,2=Only while All Events are Active
field.notes: This sprite works by allowing up to 4 input IDs to be required to activate a single output. All input IDs must be set to a relevant value. Do not leave any as '0' - if you have less than four, you can enter the same ID into several spaces.

sprite.name: Input controller - "Or" (If X OR Y, do Z)

field.name: Target Event ID
field.notes: This sprite allows up to 4 inputs to trigger the same output ID. All input IDs must be set to relevant values. Do not leave any IDs as 0 - if you have less than four, you can enter the same ID into several spaces.

field.name: Usage mode
field.values: 0=Single Use,1=Multi Use. Only while Any Event is Active
field.notes: This sprite recieves an Input ID. This selects how it will start when an input ID is received.

sprite.name: Random output controller (If X, do Y OR Z)
sprite.notes: You do not have to use all four Random ID slots, and you can use the same ID on multiple slots. Example: A in ID1, A in ID2, B in ID3. 2/3 chance of A, 1/3 chance of B

field.name: Triggering event ID
field.notes: This event causes one of the four random IDs to trigger. Random ID is Activated or Deactivated based on this value

field.name: Switch mode
field.notes: If the ID hasn't been activated by any sprite, value 1 will wait until it is activated once

field.name: Usage mode
field.notes: This is how the sprite will act once in the zone.

sprite.name: Event controller - Chainer (If X, do Y)
sprite.notes: This sprite does not count through IDs like the 286 does. It only uses the input ID to activate the output ID. From there you can have the output activate when the input is activated, and then output again the opposite on/off after the timer. Or you can set it so the output will not activate at the same time as the input, it waits the set time, and then activates the output . I guess this is used for sprites like the 168 where they ran out of nybbles to set a time function. Or for when you want to activate two sprites by only hitting one switch...Or simply to delay an ID from being sent out.

field.name: Does Nothing
field.notes: Disables the sprite

field.name: Usage mode
field.values: 0=Activate or deactivate?,1=Activate or deactivate?,2=Deactivates target when leaving the zone
field.notes: 2=Does not work with enemies, only works with Mario.

field.name: Mario power-up
field.values: 0=Any Mario,1=Small Mario,2=Super Mario,3=Fire Mario,4=Mega Mario,5=Mini Mario,6=Blue Shell Mario,7=Invincible/star Mario

field.name: Mario status
field.values: 0=In zone,1=Touching ground in zone,2=In air in zone

field.name: Enemy zone ID
field.notes: Set to 255 to ignore the status of this zone

field.name: Mario zone ID
field.notes: Set to 255 to ignore the status of this zone

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: Unused in-game Unknown - Seems to be nothing

sprite.name: Unknown
sprite.notes: It's unused in the game It's function is unknown.

field.name: Length in tiles
field.notes: 4 is the maximum limit

field.name: Sway on own +/-
field.notes: These values go from 0 (none) to F (almost horizontal). At a 4 tile (0 value length) they increase 1/2 tile at the bottom per number.

sprite.name: Moving mushroom platform
sprite.notes:
Moves to the right until it hits a wall, then goes left, until it hits a wall, ect
All values for now

field.name: Follow Lines
field.notes: 1=The stalk moves along lines.

field.name: Colour
field.notes: What is in between?

sprite.name: Unused bricks
sprite.notes:
It is glitchy with mini mario, he just falls through when it wobbles. You can work around this by putting the block in ground.
The texture inside puyo_lift.nsbtx is sampletex2. It is probably a test sprite
It's texture has full beta bricks animation. The sprite only uses one of the tiles.

field.name: Behavior
field.values: 0=Constant stretch up & down,1=Depress while stood on,2=Solid

sprite.name: Lakitu spawner
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns Lakitu inside a Zone. If Lakitu is killed, it is respawned.

field.name: Z order.
field.notes: Spiny appear behind lakitu when thrown.

sprite.name: Cheep Cheep random spawner
sprite.notes: Let spawn random generated Cheep Cheep in the selected Zone.

field.name: Zone ID
field.notes: Let spawn random generated Cheep-Cheep in the selected Zone.

field.name: Faster & out of water
field.notes: Makes some swim faster and makes them cover whole screen, not just part with water

field.name: Arrows
field.values: 0=Left Up Right,1=Left Down Right,2=Left Up Right,3=Left Right

field.name: When to spawn
field.values: 0=When entering level at beginning,1=When entering level at midpoint

sprite.name: Pipe Cannon
sprite.notes:
Is it possible to change the color of the pipe?
It is Look down at the date files That is the Pipe file that changes all normal Pipes ingame. Change that file and you got a another coloured Pipe ~Wesley
There are no other important notes.

field.name: Angle
field.values: 0=Far right,1=Far left,2=Medium right,3=Medium left,4=Straight up,5=Very far right

field.name: Input ID
field.notes: Dissappears after a few seconds even if the event which activated it does not get deactivated

sprite.name: Giant Dry Bones
sprite.notes: Shares graphics with normal Dry Bones

sprite.name: Big Thwomp
sprite.notes: Can destroy the same bricks as Mega Mario and Spiked Balls can.

sprite.name: 0 Stick to bottom length activator left
sprite.notes: The DS screen is 12 tiles high. When this is used as a top limit, it will control the tiles below the icon. As a bottom limit, it controls tiles above.

field.name: Pix. past limit
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit. This will shift 12 tile screen down from icon position.

field.name: Death below limit
field.notes: Must be empty map block, no tiles below. Mario image must fall out of screen.

sprite.name: 0 Stick to bottom length activator right
sprite.notes: The DS screen is 12 tiles high. When this is used as a top limit, it will control the tiles below the icon. As a bottom limit, it controls tiles above. This sprite is used to center the screen.

field.name: Pix. past for limit
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit. This will shift 12 tile screen down from icon position.

field.name: Death below limit
field.notes: Must be empty map block, no tiles below. Mario image must fall out of screen.

field.name: Block Type
field.values: 0=Red blocks,1=Bricks,2=Blue coins,3=Stone blocks,4=Wood blocks,6=Right facing red pipe top edge,7=Broken red pipe top right edge,15=Used block

sprite.name: In air vertical scroll stop left

field.name: Visible Y pix. past
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit.

field.name: Allow disable
field.notes: Can only be set to a max of 31 pixels. Past that move the sprite.

sprite.name: In air vertical scroll stop right

field.name: Visible Y pix. past
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit.

sprite.name: Slow Purple Tilt Mushroom (Unused)
sprite.notes: Unused. Tilts slower than used purple tilting mushroom. Fits perfectly with the stalk object in the snow with ice tileset.

field.name: Length
field.notes: Fire snake length extends from sprite position to right

sprite.name: Sledge Brother
sprite.notes: Can destroy brick/wood/stone blocks.

field.name: Star ID
field.notes: These must be the same number of stars as in the original level. Each star must have a unique ID, starting from 1. If not, the game will hang.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: 0=Ignore. Spawns when activated.

field.name: Avoid Mario
field.notes: Goes away from Mario.

sprite.name: Blooper Nanny (unused)
sprite.notes:
Never releases Baby Bloopers. Acts like regular Blooper.
"Only someone with direct access to the database can procede this modification : Class ID is actually 144, not 2 !"

field.name: Avoid Mario
field.notes: Goes away from Mario.

sprite.name: Blooper Nanny + Pursuers Baby Bloopers
sprite.notes: This Blooper Nanny will glow after a while in a rainbow-like flash fashion and then release 4 Baby Bloopers. Rinse and Repeat.

field.name: Avoid Mario
field.notes: Goes away from Mario.

sprite.name: Auto scroll start
sprite.notes:
Probably triggerable by an event
This sprite have to use together with paths. Unknown 1 is for speed. It should be divisible by 8. Unknown 3 maybe acceleration from former node's speed to this node's speed.
And I've found some interesting formula: x=98k/y. Where k is a amount of pixel being passed within x mario's second. And y is the value you entered in unknown 1. It relates together. But it might not always work. It may have something to do with unknown 3 too...
Calculation example: let say you want a sprite to move camera up 4 tiles within 16 mario sec.. Your formula is x=98k/y. As 4 tiles=64 pixels. Substitute it, then you have to multiply it with 98. 98x64=6272. And subtitute x with 16. Then 16=6272/y. And solve it to find y. After you got y, you insert that number into unknown 1. And test it in the emu, does 4 tiles are passed within 16 mario sec. or not? But I think it does. Remember unknown 3 ? 0. Sometimes the time don't have to be whole number. Also, I think the position where the sprite is first recognized by the game will determine the camera movement along the path. (Camera movement to the right , left, or straightly of the path) And there're some nybbles controlling how the sprite will act; wait for Mario to come near then scroll or scroll immediately when recognized. I don't know which, but it does have. That's all I've found. :) Hope this help!

field.name: Path ID
field.notes: Sets the path the camera will follow while scrolling. The upper left corner of the Screen (relative to Sprite placement) is the starting point for the path. Please note, it's not possible to 'trick the Screen' to leave the Zone due to scrolling.

field.name: Last node behaviour
field.notes: See NSMBWii's sprite data

field.name: Input ID
field.notes: Make it start

field.name: Output ID
field.notes: When the autoscroller reaches its final path point, this Event ID is triggered.

sprite.name: Spike Top
sprite.files: /enemy/toge_met_body.nsbmd toge means horn (as in spike on an animal)

sprite.name: Bowser Jr. boss
sprite.notes:
Values 3 and 4 are not used at all. Value 5 is used internally by the game in W8 Final Castle area 3. Value 7 is used in W8 Tower 1 area 2 (only in the European, Korean and Chinese roms).
Test the unknowns :P I know for a fact that there is something that determines if Bowser Jr. will have collision to certain sprites like the drawbridge.

field.name: Unknown 3
field.notes: Unused. To use with nybble4. If both nybble3 and nybble4 are different from 0, Bowser Jr. will stay idle until you stomp him once, then will resume the battle as it normally should.

field.name: Unknown 4
field.notes: Unused. To use with nybble3. If both nybble3 and nybble4 are different from 0, Bowser Jr. will stay idle until you stomp him once, then will resume the battle as it normally should.

field.name: Battle mode
field.notes: Unused. If final boss battle is chosen, Bowser Jr. will have the same "death" as in the final boss battle

field.name: Unknown 7
field.notes: Used in-game. Unknown effect.

field.name: Speed progression
field.values: 0=slow slow med,1=slow med med,2=slow med fast

field.name: Camera
field.notes: Bowser Jr changes the camera if player moves out of the small area around him

sprite.name: Micro Goomba
sprite.notes: Jumps with 'wah' even though it is used in any view with the 'wah' in the music.

field.name: Behavior
field.values: 0=Hangs on web,1=Drops on ground,2=Drops on ground (different stomp)
field.notes: Ignores nybble 10 if you choose Drops on ground. 2= same as 1 but it falls off screen when stomped instead of getting squished

sprite.name: Water
sprite.notes: If you plan to make the water move by itself, it is advised to use only speed values between 0 and 127 because it does not work properly with lowering values.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: On ID 1 the water will rise then lower.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: On ID 2 the water will rise, but have to be activated again with a stop command to lower.

field.name: Water lowering's delay
field.notes: Any value other than 0 will override both Input IDs.

field.name: Water rising's delay
field.notes: Any value other than 0 will override both Input IDs.

field.name: Opacity
field.notes: Modulo 32. 0 is transparent. 31 has the highest opacity.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Modulo 128. If lower than 128 then the water will rise, if greater or equal than 128 the water will lower.

field.name: Contents
field.values: 0=Coin,1=Fire flower,2=Starman,3=1UP,4=Fire flower,5=Mini mushroom,6=Blue shell,7=Mega mushroom,8=Red mushroom,9=Red mushroom

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height is nybble11 mod 8

sprite.name: Lava
sprite.notes:
Without either input ID, the lava will rise automatically.
If you set a value for either one of the IDs by themselves, the lava will rise to the height you select when that ID is activated.
If you set a values for both IDs, ID1 will make the lava go up then down. ID2 will only make the lava rise, and will wait for an off command from the ID2 activator again.
Nybbles 6 and 7 don't seem to have an effect. But they are used ingame.
Nybbles 4 and 5 could still do something.

field.name: Unknown 6
field.notes: Can't see a change for nybble 6.

field.name: Unknown 7
field.notes: Can't see a change for nybble 7.

field.name: Speed to rise
field.notes: Modulo 128. If lower than 128 then the lava will rise, if greater or equal than 128 the lava will lower.

sprite.name: Star Coin
sprite.files: /enemy/coin.nsbmd (star coin visible) /enemy/blie_coin.nsbmd (star coin invisible and gray)

field.name: Output ID
field.notes: Output ID will activate another sprite.

field.name: Timer when ID set
field.notes: Timer works just like switches.

sprite.name: Broozer
sprite.notes:
The punching ghost, that can break the same blocks as Mega-Mario and Bob-ombs can.
It's sound effects are in the ghost house music.

sprite.name: Rise/Lower Mushroom
sprite.notes: Has the same data as sprite 312.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: 0=Ignore this setting

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: 0=Ignore this setting

field.name: Return to original position
field.notes: The mushroom will return to its original position once Mario/Luigi gets off it.

field.name: Stalk height and move direction
field.notes: If this is positive it will goes up, else it will go down.

sprite.name: Rotating Bullet Bill cannon
sprite.notes: First checkboxes are bottom cannons.

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height is 1 + (nybble7 mod 8)

field.name: Empty apots
field.notes: individual bits indicate empty spots

field.name: Cannons to flip
field.notes: individual bits indicate flipped cannons

sprite.name: Balloon Boo
sprite.notes: When using an input ID, the area below Balloon Boo hurts Mario. You can't see anything there, but the game sees it as part of the sprite. When you activate the input ID, the area goes away, and Balloon Boo returns to normal.

field.name: Act like a standard Boo
field.notes: Unused, the Balloon Boo will act exactly like an original Boo, but the hitbox will be glitchy, so it is not generally recommended for use.

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height is 4 + (nybble8 mod 4)

field.name: Width
field.notes: Width is 4 + (nybble11 mod 4)

field.name: Zone ID
field.notes: Required, or he will not move.

field.name: Fire Direction
field.notes: 1 and 2 are Unused

field.name: Chase When Angry
field.notes: This makes him chase Mario if hit by a fireball/Raining Debris. If not set, he will run left and right.

sprite.name: Jungle FG Effect (Unused)
sprite.notes: The height of the Sprite is 4 blocks. The image is repeated sideways.

field.name: Scroll Up/Down
field.notes: If swimmable, the image doesn't move. If negative value it scrolls down, if positive value it scrolls up.

field.name: Start right
field.notes: Default is left side. Check to start right.

field.name: Avoid Mario
field.notes: Also swims faster

sprite.name: Spike Bass (Unused)
sprite.notes: This Spike Bass does not require a water height.

sprite.name: Poison Water
sprite.notes:
This will not rise automatically like lava if you don't have an input ID set.
ID 1 will rise to set height, then auto return to normal. ID 2 will rise to height and wait for Input ID with a "stop" setting to lower.
Nybbles 6 and 7 don't seem to have an effect. But they are used ingame.
Nybbles 4 and 5 could still do something.

field.name: Input ID 1
field.notes: On ID 1 the posion water will rise then lower.

field.name: Input ID 2
field.notes: On ID 2 the posion water will rise, but have to be activated again with a stop command to lower.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Modulo 128. If lower than 128 then the poisoned water will rise, if greater or equal than 128 the poisoned water will lower.

sprite.name: Fast giant falling spike
sprite.notes: Falling Spike

sprite.name: Increase chance of drops on Mega-Mario groundpound
sprite.notes: Only increase the CHANCE to drop Goombas when Groundpounding.

sprite.name: Invisible Podoboo (unused)
sprite.notes: Is an invisible fireball that will follow you if near, or fly a straight path from where it was placed. Pointing Hands will point to the invisible fireball location. Uses the same texture as Podoboo.

sprite.name: Underwater Bounce Bubble
sprite.notes: If it is ground pounded it will be destroyed, which is a unused behaviour.

field.name: Horizontal shift ×2
field.notes: Will shift by nybble10 × 2 pixels to the direction chosen with nybble 11.

sprite.name: Giant Wiggler
sprite.notes: There's a path ID value for this sprite. However, the path ID is 0, and the path ID is different for the Dorrie, auto-scrolling, and "Block Train" (Moving Green Blocks) sprite and it may have a different Path ID. Investigate.

sprite.name: Smashed pipe sprite
sprite.notes:
The effect will activate every time you get to the point were you can see the sprite. This sprite gets spawned in-game every time you break a pipe as mega Mario. This is only the case for a certain data.
NOTE: There was sprite data controlling the size, color and behavior. Must investigate.
http://board.dirbaio.net/thread.php?id=353 Please check here.

field.name: Facing?
field.notes: 0-9 destroy?

sprite.name: Sinking Snow
sprite.notes: Length of 0 makes the game crash!

field.name: Length
field.notes: Game will crash if set to 0!

sprite.name: Blockhopper
sprite.notes: A value of 5 for nybble 9 will yield different results for each region : US : Starman JP : Flower EU : Mini-mushroom KS : Blue shell CH : Mushroom/flower

field.name: Item
field.notes: 5=starman (US), flower, (JP) mini-mushroom (EU), blue shell (KS), mushroom/flower (CH)

field.name: Height
field.notes: Higher values will slow down the game.

sprite.name: Scroll and Mario stop sideways
sprite.notes:
Remember, the DS screen is 16 tiles wide. Make sure you allow for the full width of the screen or you camera will scroll shaky. Using X coordinates, numerically these should be 15 tiles apart.
This sprite, along with 198/199, doesn't always work. Try moving 276s up or down if they don't work.
Sprite must be placed at the bottom of the limit. Height is counted from the sprite position up.
When using retro scroll horizontal, you have to select "stop from scrolling left".
These can be passed through using a connected pipe.

field.name: Tile height up
field.notes: You can calculate by map Y coordinates.

field.name: Direction
field.values: 0=Stop from scrolling right,1=Stop from scrolling left

field.name: Type
field.values: 0=Faces up; opens from left,1=Faces up; opens from right,2=Faces down; opens from left,3=Faces down; opens from right,4=Faces right; opens from bottom,5=Faces right; opens from top,6=Faces left; opens from bottom,7=Faces left; opens from top
field.notes: Nybble 8+ is 2 tiles higher opens from left, and can't be touched by Mario.

sprite.name: Horizontal camera offset
sprite.notes:
You must set values for right and below tiles distances to activate. These are just like zones, the tiles are coordinates of activation. Setting either setting to zero will not give Mario an area to activate the sprite.
The default game lag is 2 tiles. This is in addition to that lag. This will shift Mario's center to one side or the other.
Camera will not return to normal until re-entering sprite zone. So far, at least until more data is found.

field.name: Pixel offset +=left
field.notes: Default value is 2 tiles (32 pixels) either way from center

field.name: Pixels to full offset
field.notes: This is how many pixels Mario needs to move past the sprite until it reaches the full horizontal offset.

field.name: Pixel zone below
field.notes: This is how many pixels below the sprite that the sprite can be activated in.

sprite.name: Swinging Vine
sprite.notes: Requires BOTH sprite sets "Vine" and "Rope". If not, it crashes.

sprite.name: Splunkin
sprite.notes: /enemy/kabochan.nsbmd

sprite.name: Event controller - Multi-chainer (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)
sprite.notes: In NSMBwii's editor this is called "Event Controller - Multi-Chainer" (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)"

field.name: Start Event ID
field.notes: The activator will start running when this Event ID is triggered.

field.name: End Event ID
field.notes: The activator will trigger all events from the start event ID to this event ID (including this one).

sprite.name: Enemy-in-Pipe Generator
sprite.notes: Uses sound set 8 for Bob-ombs

field.name: Slower Spawn Rate
field.notes: Unused (From NSMBW)

sprite.name: Winged ? Block
sprite.files:
enemy/pata_block.nsbmd
this nsbmd contains red and gold flying blocks + wings sprites: 117 and 290

field.name: Output ID
field.notes: Trigger another ID when switch selected.

field.name: 16 tile loop
field.values: 0=Fly off screen,1=Center of loop,2=Edge of loop

field.name: Item
field.values: 0=Coin,1=Mushroom/flower,2=Starman,3=1UP,4=? switch,5=P-switch,6=Red ! switch,7=Vine with Mario clone,8=Mini mushroom

field.name: Pointing hands ID
field.notes: Pointing hands only.

field.name: Output mode
field.notes: Activation has to be started/enabled. Can toggle once started or ended by hitting the opposite sw. again.

field.name: Input mode
field.notes: Timer mode automatically resets switch to opposite output mode. Or it can be reset by another switch. With no timer, a start/stop toggle will respawn when you leave then return to the screen.

field.name: Timer mode
field.notes: When timed, switch starts in start or stop. While timed, it is opposite.

field.name: Time out sw. delay
field.notes: In seconds. Only delays multiple on/off hits

field.name: Upside down
field.notes: When hit, an upside down ? switch will appear where the brick block was.

sprite.name: Touching ground vertical scroll stop left
sprite.notes:
This sprite seems to disable all other camera sprites when activated.
It also changed horizontal scrolling...I think.

field.name: Visible Y pix. past
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit.

field.name: Disable Y pix. past
field.notes: Can only be set to a max of 31 pixels. Past that move the sprite.

sprite.name: Touching ground vertical scroll stop right
sprite.notes: This sprite seems to disable all other camera sprites when activated.

field.name: Visible Y pix. past
field.notes: Pixels able to be seen past limit.

field.name: Disable Y pix. past
field.notes: Can only be set to a max of 31 pixels. Past that move the sprite.

sprite.name: Horizontal moving platform (unused duplicate)
sprite.notes: Exact duplicate of used horizontal moving platform. Same settings. Different class ID.

sprite.name: Horizontal moving stone block (unused duplicate)
sprite.notes: Exact duplicate of used horizontal moving stone block. Same settings. Different class ID.

field.name: Height
field.notes: Height formula is 2^(n mod 4) with n being the value of this nybble.

field.name: Unknown 10
field.notes: Used in-game, useless.

field.name: Tiles to move
field.notes: Negative numbers = down/left. Positive numbers up/right. NOT diagonal for example - ticking "Horizontal movement" and "Tiles to move" to minus -7 will make it move left one block. For vertical movement -8 is no move movement -7 is down one -6 is down two ect

sprite.name: Snake Block (Moving Green Blocks)
sprite.notes: It owns sudden mind to decimate unspecified substantial tiles amidst lures way. (It destroys solid tiles) Probably because the sprite spawns the green block tiles in the main tile set.

field.name: Behavior at last node
field.values: 0=Nothing (keeps shape),1=Falls apart (doesn't keep shape),2=Comes back and forth,3=Skyrockets (keeps shape),4=Falls apart (keeps shape)
field.notes: Game will freeze if value%8 is 5 or 6.

field.name: Path ID
field.notes: If you don't have a matching ID, the game will freeze.

sprite.name: Toadsworth
sprite.notes: What is the unused type? Well, it makes glitchy blocks that do nothing. Never use it.

field.name: Type
field.notes: 1 is glitchy.

field.name: Backward delay
field.notes: 60 frames = 1 second.

sprite.notes: Has the same data as sprites 311, 313, 316, 317, 318, 319, 320, 321 and 322.

field.name: Swaying start position
field.notes: Also doubles as a direction value (Modulo 4) if nybble 10 and/or nybble 11 are not null. 0 is left-down, 1 is left-up, 2 is right-down and 3 is right-up.

field.name: Swaying distance
field.notes: 0 is static.

field.name: Swaying speed
field.notes: 0 is static, 15 is the fastest.

field.name: Mixed shift
field.notes: Shift horizontally and vertically.

field.name: Horizontal scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Horizontal speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Opacity
field.notes: Modulo 32. 0 is transparent, 30 is almost opaque, 31 is completely red.

field.name: Horizontal scrolling

field.name: Vertical scrolling

sprite.name: Soft Cloud Platform
sprite.notes: Unused tile version in Sky tileset (World 7)

field.name: Length
field.notes: Cloud extends from sprite position to the right.

sprite.name: Grassland Clouds FG effect
sprite.notes: Has the same data as sprites 310, 315 and 325.

field.name: Opacity
field.notes: Modulo 32. 0 is transparent, 30 is almost opaque, 31 is completely red.

field.name: Mixed shift
field.notes: Shift horizontally and vertically.

field.name: Horizontal scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Horizontal speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

sprite.name: Smaller Grassland Clouds FG effect
sprite.notes: Has the same data as sprites 310, 315 and 324. Direction: list at nybble 4: 0=Left-down,1=Left-up,2=Right-down,3=Right-up Opacity: value at nybble 5-6. Modulo 32. 0 is transparent, 30 is almost opaque, 31 is completely red. Mixed shift: value at nybble 7. Shift horizontally and vertically. Horizontal scrolling: value at nybble 8. 0 is the slowest, 15 is the fastest. Vertical scrolling: value at nybble 9. 0 is the slowest, 15 is the fastest. Horizontal speed: value at nybble 10. 0 is the slowest, 15 is the fastest. Vertical speed: value at nybble 11. 0 is the slowest, 15 is the fastest.

field.name: Opacity
field.notes: Modulo 32. 0 is transparent, 30 is almost opaque, 31 is completely red.

field.name: Mixed shift
field.notes: Shift horizontally and vertically.

field.name: Horizontal scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical scrolling
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Horizontal speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.

field.name: Vertical speed
field.notes: 1 is the slowest, 16 is the fastest.
